metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000032 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-Site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Cacti 0.8.8b allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the parent_id parameter to tree.php and drp_action parameter to data_sources.php.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8f+ds1-4ubuntu4.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8f+ds1-4ubuntu4.16.04.2').
